conclusion: Principles of refraction and refractive index are needed to solve the problem.
Refractive index measures how much a light ray is bent when passing from one medium to another.
Refractive index of water is the ratio of the speed of light in water to the speed of light in a vacuum.
Diver uses a laser to send a signal to shore rescuers, angle between laser beam and water surface is alpha.
Speed of light in water is denoted as v_w and in vacuum as v_0.
According to Snell's law, angle of refraction theta is given by v_0/v_w = sin(theta).
Angle of refraction theta is alpha, angle of incidence theta' is 90 degrees - alpha.
Using Snell's law, v_0/v_w = sin(90 degrees - alpha) = cos(alpha).
Refractive index of water n_w = v_w/v_0 = cos(alpha)/sin(alpha).
Substitute cos(41 degrees) and sin(41 degrees) into the equation to find n_w.
The refractive index of water is 1.
